author: Special Correspondent
text:
Toning down his stand on the Ram temple issue, the Vishwa Hindu Parishad’s national working president Pravin Togadia on Saturday voted for a “legal” solution to the issue. He said the Modi government should enact a law to make the construction of Ram temple possible at Ayodhya.

Describing Prime Minister Narendra Modi as his “elder brother”, he said the VHP and its associates will not raise the issue of Ram temple building or launch an agitation demanding it until the Uttar Pradesh elections are over. He was confident that the Prime Minister would do everything to “respect the Hindu sentiments.”

Mr. Togadia recalled that Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel had enacted a law to make the re-building of Somnath temple possible. Mr. Modi should choose a similar path, he said. He was speaking after inaugurating the Bajrang Dal baitak here on Saturday. Asked about the Supreme Court saying that women cannot be banned from entering the Sabarimala temple in Kerala, he said while God favoured all equally, women should desist from being “influenced by western culture”.
title: Togadia for legal solution to Ram temple issue
